title.narrative: WASH ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: By 2025, Government authorities at federal and member state levels are better able to plan, coordinate and monitor the delivery of adequate, equitable and affordable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, more children and their families, particularly in rural and poor urban areas and in humanitarian situations, use affordable, sustainable and safely managed water and sanitation services, practice safe hygiene behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, Government authorities at federal and member state levels are better able to plan, coordinate and monitor the delivery ofadequate, equitable and affordable WASH services

description.narrative: UNICEF has continued the engagement and capacity building of key WASH government Ministries and departments to build capacity enhance service delivery, build resilience and sustainability. Government ministries or agencies at federal and states level have been involved in key life-saving interventions such as water trucking. The ministries convened sector coordination and technical working groups to address emerging challenges in the sector. Key policy and guidance documents developed and approved include the National WASH Policy, National Water Resource Management Strategy, the Puntland Water Policy approval and, WASH in Schools Guidelines for Class 5-8 were great milestones to the sector. | Status:Met | As-of Date:06/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of WASH policy documents, strategies, standards, protocols, roadmaps developed, and other guidance documents developed with UNICEF support, Text

target.value: 2025:At least 4: 1. Sanitation Road Map 2. National standard for WASH in schools 3. National standards for WASH in health facilities. 4. National Water Resources Management Strategy
